intro: Avena longiglumis subvar. australis, commonly known as the Australian oat, is a perennial grass native to Australia. It features slender, erect stems that can grow up to 1.5 meters in height, with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces spikelets that are typically 2–4 cm long, bearing small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its seeds are edible and have been used by Indigenous Australians for food and other traditional purposes.
